content: You're absolutely right! Public transportation can be a more sustainable and eco-friendly mode of transportation, but for many people, the cost of a daily commute can be a significant barrier to fully adopting it. One solution to this is to provide more affordable fares, especially for daily commuters or low-income riders. Cities could also offer discounted passes or fare reductions for certain groups like students, seniors, and disadvantaged communities. Additionally, government subsidies could be provided to public transit operators to help lower fares and make them more affordable for everyone. By making public transportation more affordable, it would become a more attractive option to motorists, which in turn would help in reducing the number of cars on the road and lessen the city's carbon footprint. Encouraging public transportation use, therefore, not only reduces the environmental impact but also provides an affordable, accessible and faster means of transportation for everyone.
